segment.source: Use the Select Task page to modify an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Use the Select Task page to modify an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: For more information about modifying an existing virtual application package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about modifying an existing virtual application package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: This page contains the following elements:
segment.target: This page contains the following elements:

segment.source: Select this option to apply an update to an application or program that is part of an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Select this option to apply an update to an application or program that is part of an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: If you select this option, you should have the associated installation files saved locally to the computer running the App-V Sequencer.
segment.target: If you select this option, you should have the associated installation files saved locally to the computer running the App-V Sequencer.

segment.source: You must also have access to the location where the package that contains the application or program that you want to modify is saved.
segment.target: You must also have access to the location where the package that contains the application or program that you want to modify is saved.

segment.source: Select this option to modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Select this option to modify the properties associated with an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: To edit a package, you must have access to the location where the virtual application package is saved.
segment.target: To edit a package, you must have access to the location where the virtual application package is saved.

segment.source: The following list displays the package properties that can be updated if you select Edit Package:
segment.target: The following list displays the package properties that can be updated if you select Edit Package:

segment.source: Review additional package settings (except operating system file properties).
segment.target: Review additional package settings (except operating system file properties).

segment.source: Set virtualized registry key state (override / merge).
segment.target: Set virtualized registry key state (override / merge).

segment.source: Select this option to add a new application or program to an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: Select this option to add a new application or program to an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: For example, you can add Microsoft Excel to an existing Microsoft Office virtual application package.
segment.target: For example, you can add Microsoft Excel to an existing Microsoft Office virtual application package.

segment.source: To add a new application, you must have access to the location where the virtual application package is saved.
segment.target: To add a new application, you must have access to the location where the virtual application package is saved.

segment.source: You can also edit file type associations associated with an existing package.
segment.target: You can also edit file type associations associated with an existing package.
